A message from Mr. Lyon,

The Board of Trustees met last night to accept my resignation. As I stated before, I appreciate all you have done to help impact the lives of each and every student here at HISD. I will always be a Hawk at heart. I will head to Austin this summer to help fight for not only what is best for Hawkins but also the whole State of Texas.

I am confident with her leadership the district will not have one moment of hesitation toward success. Remodeled HES Library and Impact on Student Performance
In comparison, from August to December of 2018 to the same months in 2019, our HES students have made remarkable growth in reading. One large factor in the reading growth is the improved library services and school renovations at HES. We have seen an increase in the number of words read from 9.7 million to 24.5 million words. Students have taken over 8,000 tests on Accelerated Reader as compared to the previous year of nearly 4,000. Their reading average has increased from the prior year of 76.8% to 80.5%. The average book level is now 3.7, which is higher than the previous year of 3.2. Our students have increased significantly in their AR points earned from 2369 to 5768 points. Way to go HAWKS!

Students have taken over 8,000 tests on Accelerated Reader as compared to the previous year of nearly 4,000. Their reading average has increased from the prior year of 76.8% to 80.5%. The average book level is now 3.7, which is higher than the previous year of 3.2. Our students have increased significantly in their AR points earned from 2369 to 5768 points. Way to go HAWKS!

Katelyn Prater, Miguel Acatitlan and Juan Juarez left for State Competition! These three students are competing in a STEM event in Huntsville this weekend. This is provided by TAME, Texas Alliance of Minorities in Engineering.

Every year, TAME brings together students to compete and celebrate achievement in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM). During a STEM Competition, students participate in both a math and a science test, and then team up in different engineering roles to solve real-world problems in a timed Engineering Design Challenge.

Ms Cranford is the STEM coach, and she has worked hard to start this STEM Club at HES this year. We are very excited for our students to represent Hawkins ISD at this event.
